rule_text: A surprising or unusual angle - not routine news like 'Mayor opens new park'
Completely wholesome content - nothing that would embarrass a parent reading to children
Simple, clear language understandable at 8th-grade reading level - no jargon or technical terms
A delightful or charming quality that produces a smile, chuckle, or sense of wonder
Connection to everyday life - relatable to people who farm, cook, build, raise families
Emphasis on community, togetherness, simple pleasures, OR focus on animals/nature/products
Sexual content, innuendo, dating apps, relationship drama, suggestive humor
Modern technology: smartphones, AI, robots, social media (TikTok, Instagram), video games, streaming, electric vehicles
Death, fatal accidents, tragedies, disasters, 'miraculous survival' stories
Violence, crime, murders, assaults, robberies, 'justice served' stories
Depressing or negative stories: economic doom, environmental collapse, 'world getting worse' narratives
Political controversy: elections, politicians, policy debates, partisan content, culture war topics
Religious controversy: debates between denominations, criticism of faith traditions, evangelism stories
War, military, armed conflict: veterans stories, troops coming home, military technology, battles, WWII reunions
Individual hero or record-breaking stories for humans: oldest person to climb mountain, teacher runs marathon, Guinness World Records, local man saves family
Competitive sports or individual athletic achievement: player breaks scoring record, Olympics, professional sports highlights
Animals: unusual behavior, unlikely friendships, pets with quirky habits, farm animals doing charming things, wildlife encounters (non-threatening)
Food: bizarre flavor combinations, strange food products, food festivals, giant vegetables, unusual harvests, traditional recipes revived
Community efforts: towns working together, neighbors helping neighbors, barn raisings, volunteer projects where no single person is the star
Nature and weather: unusual weather phenomena, remarkable plants, seasonal phenomena, beautiful natural formations, animal migrations
Small-town life: quirky town traditions, local festivals, covered bridge celebrations, historical preservation, charming town characters
Oddities and quirky products: bizarre products, unusual discoveries, miniature things, giant things, things in wrong places, silly surveys
Individual craftsmanship: blacksmith practicing 60 years - lean toward INCLUDE if the craft is the focus, not the person's fame
Heritage railways and steam trains: generally SAFE, volunteer groups restoring engines have community angle, avoid stories focused on one charismatic restorer
Historical anniversaries: 150-year-old bridge celebrated - generally SAFE, about heritage and craftsmanship
Group sports: local community softball, children's field day - MAY BE ACCEPTABLE if emphasis is on togetherness, not winning
Animal records: world's largest pumpkin, tallest horse, oldest tortoise - generally ACCEPTABLE (not human ego)
Good news human interest: community rallying around sick child - USE CAUTION. If illness is focus, REJECT. If community response is focus and child recovering, might work.
